displayName.text: Memorial Sloan Kettering Patient Urgent Care Cencer

formattedAddress: 425 E 67th St, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 425 E 67th St, New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text: My experience was deeply appreciated and well worth the wait. I personally feel that the staff valued me as a patient from the time I had entered the facility. I was treated with respect and compassion. When you are sick, scared, and feeling anxious and don't know what's going on with you aside from your cancer. You're going to need some patience, empathy, and understanding provided from both sides because we all are in need of some extra care and comfortable. We, the patient, have to remember there are a lot more patients than there is staff. Yes, Quality Services and Accountability is Absolutely Mandatory and is non-negotiable. I was met with prompted services, while at Urgent Care, Hospitalized, visiting Outpatient Care, received Radiation, Chemotherapy, Collected Bone Marrow Cells for my Transplants, Double Macestomy among other things to ensure my best of care. It's not easy, but I am making it through. I have, for one, have two successful stories and could not have done it without all of the staff doctors, nurses, lab techs, assistants, coordinating assistants,  managers, secretary, clerks, dietary staff, maintenance staff, social workers, navigators and pastoral care. I began my fight with cancer in 2015 and the second time around was  July 29, 2022. I would have never made it through my personal patient experience and journey had it not been for all of the kind services received. Thank you all for tireless spirits and  helping me along my journey. God bless you all.üôèüèΩüôèüèΩüôèüèΩüôèüèΩ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

originalText.text:
The best! After my cancer surgery, I had to come here 5 times and they were quick and attentive every single time. The facility is spotless and the doctors and nurses are all really wonderful and kind.

I am, fortunately, cancer-free and will never need to come here again. The unfortunate thing is that this is the best emergency room I have ever been to in NYC, so I am worried if I ever have to go to a different one now.

And by the way, I am a Black woman, so don't know what the other reviewer was insinuating. NO Memorial Sloane Kettering doctors ‚Äî in and out of the hospital ‚Äî have never treated me differently because I am Black.

originalText.text: I went in on 12/24/23 from the person who did the intake everyone moved very quickly to assess my situation. They were prompt and courteous and shortly after I felt relief. The doctor even remembered me from my previous visit to the ER two months ago. I realized afterwards that he had been the doctor that had said some nice thoughtful words since I was crying because a visitor to the ER had said very mean things to me. Anyhow, I was in and out very quickly and I found the relief I needed. I love that they have my records since I‚Äôm also an MSK patient and I can look in the portal for my results as they come in. It‚Äôs pretty cool! Fabiola was a great nurse. Both doctors that saw me where amazing. Thanks

originalText.text:
My mother visited this urgent care facility a few weeks ago. It's important to note that my mother is black. Shockingly, she had to wait for six hours without any attention until I arrived and insisted on speaking with a healthcare provider. Despite being a native Spanish speaker, my mother does understand English. However, the doctor was dismissive towards her, addressing only me and behaving as if my mother couldn't comprehend.

Tests were conducted, but they yielded no significant findings. The question remains: why should a patient have to endure a seven-hour wait for medical attention? After an exhaustive ten-hour wait, a new provider finally arrived, displaying extreme rudeness. Presumably, the prior female doctor had informed him of something, leading to his disrespectful demeanor when he examined my mother. When I requested pain medication for her, given her evident distress, he looked at me as if I were seeking controlled substances. He curtly stated, 'My job is to ensure this isn't an emergency, which it isn't,' before abruptly leaving the room.

Later, when the nurse returned, we asked for a diagnosis. To our astonishment, she seemed unfamiliar with the concept of providing a diagnosis and simply advised, 'Take more Tylenol.'

Considering this institution's international reputation, I had anticipated better care and compassion. Why should a patient seeking urgent care endure a seven-hour wait? Why do healthcare providers display unprofessional attitudes, and why do nurses trivialize pain? Is it because the patient is black? Is their race a factor?

I believed this renowned institution upheld inclusivity and provided exceptional care. Unfortunately, my experience contradicted this belief.

originalText.text: Has waiting for 3 hours, they only took culture and vitals in 3 hours. They also adjusted the IV improperly and my mom is in severe pain the whole time. She gets IV every week and never experienced this much pain. The health authority should do investigation about this place for poor management. Really nice staff, can‚Äôt complain about them, just unfortunate the ratio of staff and patient is ridiculous.
